title: Job Openings at Renmoney
content:
Renmoney - We are a passionate team determined to challenge the status quo and make financial inclusion count for the millions of under-banked individuals and small business owners in Nigeria. We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Product Manager - Wealth Management / Private Banking

Job Location: Lagos
Employment: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	Renmoney is seeking a strategic, innovative, and experienced Product Manager responsible for the development, management, and strategic positioning of wealth management and private banking products, ensuring tailored solutions that grow assets under management, drive deposit mobilization, and meet clients' sophisticated needs.
	The Product Manager balances client-centric innovation with compliance, profitability, and competitive differentiation, supporting the bank’s growth agenda in premium and retail segments.?


Key Responsibilities


	Design, launch, and manage wealth management and private banking products including fixed deposits, bonds, commercial papers, and high-value savings accounts, tailored to individuals and SMEs.?
	Conduct market research, assess customer needs, and analyze competitor offerings to inform product strategy and pipeline.?
	Monitor product performance metrics (growth, adoption, profitability, cost of funds), regularly reviewing strategy to ensure AUM and revenue targets are achieved.?
	Collaborate with digital, compliance, operations, and sales teams to ensure products are secure, scalable, and regulatory compliant.?
	Support relationship managers and sales teams with training, tools, and product information, enabling them to drive growth and cross-sell across the bank's premium client base.?
	Develop product roadmaps, prepare business cases, and manage regulatory submissions and approvals for new products and enhancements.?
	Drive customer engagement initiatives, ensuring superior client experience and retention in private banking channels.?
	Lead quarterly product reviews, ensuring internal process alignment and continuous improvement around client satisfaction and portfolio profitability.?


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree (Business, Finance, Economics, or allied disciplines); professional certifications in wealth management/financial planning are advantageous.?
	Minimum of 3–5 years of experience in product development or relationship management, ideally in wealth/private banking or financial services within the Nigerian.?
	Strong grasp of financial market trends, regulatory frameworks, and wealth management instruments relevant to microfinance and premium banking.?
	Excellent analytical, communication, and stakeholder management skills. Proficiency in digital product analytics/tools is a plus.?
	Demonstrated ability to deliver client-focused solutions and grow profitable product portfolios.?


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Senior Full-Stack Engineer, Laravel & React

Job Location: Lagos
Employment: Full-time

About the Role


	You will play a key role in the continued development, maintenance, and support of our internal systems and the next phase of our internal tools.
	This role requires a self-driven, experienced developer who is thorough, structured, and able to work independently while taking full ownership of technical decisions and feature delivery.


Tech Stack


	Backend technologies include PHP, the Laravel Framework, MySQL, and a Docker Sail development environment.
	The current frontend stack is React.js.


What You Will Do


	Develop, maintain, and support internal systems and long-term internal tools.
	Take ownership of features, technical choices, implementation, and testing.
	Work independently as the primary developer while collaborating closely with the product team.
	Ensure detailed, thorough, and well-structured implementations.
	Think beyond code-first execution and take a product ownership mindset.


Requirements
What You Bring:


	A minimum of three years of hands-on experience with Laravel.
	A minimum of three years of hands-on experience with React.js.
	Strong SQL skills.
	Experience with application containerisation.
	Senior-level, real-world development experience.
	Ability to work independently and take full ownership of deliverables,
	Strong attention to detail and structured problem-solving approach.
	Comfort working on long-term products rather than short-term engagements.
	Clear and effective communication skills.


Benefits
What’s In It For You:


	Opportunity to take true ownership of core internal systems and long-term products.
	A high-trust environment that values independence, structure, and thoughtful engineering decisions.
	Exposure to end-to-end product development, from technical design to implementation and support.
	The ability to influence technical choices and shape the evolution of internal tools.
	A role focused on building sustainable systems rather than short-term deliverables.


Click here to apply online

 

3.) Training and Development Specialist

Job Location: Lagos
Employment: Full-time

The position


	We are looking for a Training and Development specialist who will play a pivotal role in shaping our organizational learning and development initiatives.
	You will be responsible for conducting thorough research on industry trends and best practices, identifying and conducting training and learning needs, designing curriculum and course content, delivering high-quality training both virtually and in-person, and optimising staff performance to support our mission of empowering our customers and driving organisational growth.


Responsibilities


	Conduct research on industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in learning and development to ensure Renmoney MFB remains at the forefront of employee training and development.
	Collaborate with departmental heads and stakeholders to identify training needs and gaps within the organization, conducting thorough needs assessments to inform the development of targeted learning interventions.
	Utilise instructional design principles and methodologies to design engaging and effective training programs, ensuring alignment with organisational goals and objectives.
	Facilitate dynamic and interactive training sessions both virtually and in-person, utilising a variety of instructional techniques and multimedia tools to enhance learning outcomes.
	Work closely with HR and departmental managers to optimise staff performance through targeted training interventions, coaching, and performance support initiatives.
	Collaborate with the HR Department to ensure training initiatives align with organizational objectives.
	Generate comprehensive reports on impact of learning/training activities, participant feedback, and learning outcomes, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
	Assist and Deliver training sessions in a variety of formats, including classroom-based, virtual, and on-the-job training.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business / Human Resource Management, Organisational Development, related fields or professional certifications in training and development is a plus.
	Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in Learning and Development or training roles, preferably in the financial services industry.
	Advanced proficiency in MS PowerPoint, Excel, and Learning Management Systems (LMS).
	Very good communication skills, strong interpersonal skills and leadership skills to build rapport with diverse stakeholders.
	Demonstrated facilitation skills with a track record of delivering engaging and impact training sessions.
	Knowledge of curriculum and course design models such as ADDIE and SAM.


Benefits
This job is perfect for you if you:


	Are a self-starter, take initiative and work collaboratively.
	Have excellent communication skills and impeccable attention to detail.
	Thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.


You will not enjoy this job if you:


	Require clear, pre-set deliverables and constant direction.
	Are used to working in/with a large team,


What’s in it for you:


	You’ll receive competitive compensation and work with amazing people.
	You’ll work in a beautiful environment with a flat structure and solve complex, real-world challenges.


Click here to apply online

Data Analyst / Statistician Job at Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN)




        
    

        
        The Manufacturers Association of Nigeria (MAN) was established in May, 1971 as a company limited by guarantee. The establishment of the Association was motivated by the desire to have a focal point of communication and consultation between industry on the one hand, and the government and general public on the other. Hitherto, there was no institutional organ whose central focus was to give meaning to the interests, challenges and aspirations of the manufacturing sector. Hence, the group provided a forum for the private sector to formulate and articulate policy suggestions that would be complementary to government’s efforts at policy formulation.
     

            
    



MAN is in business to create a climate of opinion in Nigeria in which manufacturers can operate efficiently and profitably for the benefit of all. As the voice of manufacturers, MAN was established to promote and protect manufacturers’ collective interests.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Analyst / Statistician

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst / Statistician to lead and execute high-impact economic analyses and data-driven research projects.
	This role involves leveraging advanced economic theory, empirical methods, and large-scale datasets to inform policy, strategy, or business decisions.
	The ideal candidate is an independent thinker with deep quantitative skills, practical experience in econometric modeling, forecasting, a strong publication and theoretical background and policy advisory track record.


Key Responsibilities


	Collect, clean, and validate data from multiple sources.
	Lead the design and execution of empirical research projects, including model specification, data acquisition, and econometric analysis.
	Apply advanced statistical and economic techniques to evaluate policy interventions, market behavior, or strategic decisions.
	Manage and analyze large, complex datasets using tools such as R, Stata, or Python, Eview, SPSS. And other software.
	Produce high-quality research outputs including PowerPoints Presentation, working papers, technical reports, policy briefs, and peer-reviewed publications.
	Conduct statistical analyses and interpret results to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
	Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to support advocacy and policy decision-making.
	Communicate findings clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
	Manage Database and coordinate the implementation of data protection, governance and quality assurance.
	Translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
	Collaborate with internal teams or external stakeholders (e.g., government agencies, research institutions).
	Stay current with relevant economic literature and methodological advances.


Method of Application

Job Position: Head of Downstream Operation

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

            
    




	Lead and oversee all downstream operations (Fuel, CNG, LPG) to ensure safe, efficient, and profitable performance.
	Drive operational excellence, regulatory compliance, asset optimization, and customer satisfaction while supporting business growth.

	Manage daily operations of fuel, CNG, and LPG stations.
	Ensure safe dispensing, storage, and distribution of products.
	Monitor station performance, sales, uptime, and customer service.

	Bachelor’s in Engineering (Mechanical, Petroleum, Electrical, or related); Master’s preferred.
	2–4 years in upstream oil & gas, with at least 5 years in managerial roles.
	Professional certifications (COREN, PMP, NSE, SPE) are advantageous.
	Strong knowledge of NUPRC/DPR regulations.
	Experience in project management, maintenance, equipment servicing, and field development projects.


Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 per month.
